channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Shoot to Kill’: Accounts of Brutal Crackdown Emerge From Iran
item.description: The Iranian authorities have imposed an information blackout as they try to quell protests, but eyewitness testimony and videos conveying the deadly t...

item.title: Son of Deposed Shah of Iran Seeks Center Stage Amid Protests
item.description: Reza Pahlavi, living in exile in the United States, has long marketed himself as a future leader of Iran. His father’s repressive legacy casts a long ...

item.title: Venezuela’s Oil Riches Are Years Off, but Winners and Losers Will Emerge
item.description: Companies that already have operations in the country stand to benefit, but those that have profited from a standoff between Caracas and Washington co...

item.title: Buying a home is 150% more expensive than in 2019. But here’s why Trump’s plan to shut out institutional investors could raise costs even more
item.description: “Big investors have nothing to do with how the housing shortage got created,” says Ed Pinto, a leading housing expert.

item.title: The oil CEO who stood up to Trump is a follower of the disciplined ‘Exxon way’ with a history of blunt statements
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Can James Talarico Reclaim Christianity for the Left?
item.description: Ezra Klein and State Representative James Talarico of Texas discuss his faith, his politics and his Senate race.

item.title: Ascend Money wants to finance the 10 million-plus Thais currently being ignored by traditional banks stuck in the past
item.description: Ascend Money’s work providing financing to Thailand’s underbanked populations helped get the fintech company onto Fortune’s 2025 “Change the World” li...

item.title: Adelaide Writers’ Week Canceled After It Disinvited Palestinian Australian Author
item.description: Organizers said her presence was not “culturally sensitive” after a mass shooting that targeted Jewish Australians. Nearly 200 other writers withdrew ...

item.title: ‘Shoot to Kill’: Accounts of Brutal Crackdown Emerge From Iran
item.description: The Iranian authorities have imposed an information blackout as they try to quell protests, but eyewitness testimony and videos conveying the deadly t...

item.title: Son of Deposed Shah of Iran Seeks Center Stage Amid Protests
item.description: Reza Pahlavi, living in exile in the United States, has long marketed himself as a future leader of Iran. His father’s repressive legacy casts a long ...

item.title: At This Office Park, Scamming the World Was the Business
item.description: Times journalists got a rare look inside one of the compounds where the online fraud industry makes its billions. Inspirational slogans (“Keep going”)...

item.title: A Scientific Expedition to Antarctica’s Thwaites Glacier Deals With Weather Hiccups
item.description: The clock is ticking. But low clouds have prevented helicopters from moving scientists and gear onto the continent’s fastest-melting glacier.

item.title: The Sea Lions of the Galápagos Are Not Ready to Stop Nursing
item.description: Animals that researchers call “supersucklers” come back for their mother’s milk even after they can hunt, mate and fend for themselves.

item.title: Is Powell’s Fed head independence dead? It’s just one more diversionary trick as Trump outfoxes himself
item.description: You know what we're not talking about amid the latest Fed dustup? Trump's awful polling numbers, even among his own supporters.

item.title: Elon Musk says saving for retirement is irrelevant because AI is going to create a world of abundance: ‘It won’t matter’
item.description: Musk said a "supersonic tsunami" of AI and robotics will bring about a world of zero scarcity.
